description:
NGC 4559 is a mixed spiral galaxy around 30 million light years away in the constellation of Coma Berenices.  'Mixed' here means that it is somewhere between a barred spiral and an unbarred spiral.  The galaxy spans around 100,000 light years and has a total mass of around 40 billion Suns (O'Meara - The Caldwell Objects: Second Edition; CUP 2016).  Sir Patrick Moore listed the galaxy as object 36 in his list of Caldwell objects.

NGC 4559 was photographed between 13 January and 14 February 2021.  

Capture details are as follows:

Telescope: TEC 140
Camera: QSI 690
Filters: Astrodon
Mount: 10 Micron GM2000HPS (2020); Mesu 200 (2018)

Ha: 15 x 1200s
Lum: 48 x 600s
Red: 30 x 300s
Green 30 x 300s
Blue: 30 x 300s

A total of 20 hours and 30 minutes exposure.

Data: Steve Milne & Barry Wilson
Processing: Steve Milne
title: NGC 4559 (Caldwell 36) in Coma Berenices
